meanings.definition: Make (something) seem less important, significant, or complex than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She kept trivializing the importance of his hard work.
meanings.sent2: Stop trivializing the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent3: The way he trivialized the math problem made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her constant trivializing of the issue turned it into a mere joke.
meanings.sent5: Trivializing the safety guidelines could lead to dangerous consequences.

meanings.definition: To treat (something) as unimportant or insignificant.
meanings.sent1: He was trivializing the effort she put into the project.
meanings.sent2: Don't trivialize the impact of your words on others.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's act trivialized the seriousness of the topic.
meanings.sent4: Her actions trivialized the value of teamwork in the project.
meanings.sent5: Trivializing the environmental concerns may harm future generations.
